00077    /*
00078    * Default constructor.
00079    */
00080    template <typename Data>
00081    DRaggedMatrix<Data>::DRaggedMatrix() :
00082       RaggedMatrix<Data>()
00083    {}
00084      
00085    #if 0 
00086    /*
00087    * Copy constructor.
00088    */
00089    template <typename Data>
00090    DRaggedMatrix<Data>::DRaggedMatrix(const DRaggedMatrix<Data>& other) 
00091      : RaggedMatrix<Data>()
00092    {
00093 
00094       // Precondition
00095       if (other.data_ == 0) {
00096          UTIL_THROW("Other DRaggedMatrix must be allocated");
00097       }
00098 
00099       allocate(other.capacity1_, other.capacity2_);
00100 
00101       // Copy elements
00102       for (int i = 0; i < capacity1_*capacity2_; ++i) {
00103          data_[i] = other.data_[i];
00104       }
00105    }
00106    #endif
00107   
00108    #if 0 
00109    /*
00110    * Assignment.
00111    */
00112    template <typename Data>
00113    DRaggedMatrix<Data>& DRaggedMatrix<Data>::operator = (const DRaggedMatrix<Data>& other) 
00114    {
00115 
00116       // Check for self assignment.
00117       if (this == &other) return *this;
00118 
00119       // Precondition
00120       if (other.data_ == 0) {
00121          UTIL_THROW("RHS DRaggedMatrix must be allocated in assignment");
00122       }
00123 
00124       // If this this DRaggedMatrix if not allocated, allocate now.
00125       // If this this DRaggedMatrix is allocated, check that capacities are equal.
00126       if (data_ == 0) {
00127          allocate(other.capacity1_, other.capacity2_);
00128       } else {
00129          if (capacity1_ != other.capacity1_ || 
00130              capacity2_ != other.capacity2_) {
00131             UTIL_THROW("Unequal capacities in assignment");
00132          }
00133       }
00134 
00135       // Copy elements
00136       for (int i = 0; i < capacity1_*capacity2_; ++i) {
00137          data_[i] = other.data_[i];
00138       }
00139 
00140       return *this;
00141    }
00142    #endif
00143 
00144    /*
00145    * Destructor.
00146    */
00147    template <typename Data>
00148    DRaggedMatrix<Data>::~DRaggedMatrix()
00149    {
00150       if (data_ != 0) {
00151          delete [] data_;
00152       }
00153       if (rows_ != 0) {
00154          delete [] rows_;
00155       }
00156       if (capacity2_ != 0) {
00157          delete [] capacity2_;
00158       }
00159    }
00160 
00161    /*
00162    * Allocate memory and set row sizes.
00163    */
00164    template <typename Data>
00165    void DRaggedMatrix<Data>::allocate(const DArray<int>& rowSizes)
00166    {
00167       int i, capacity;
00168 
00169       if (data_ != 0) 
00170          UTIL_THROW("Attempt to re-allocate a RaggedMatrix");
00171 
00172       if (rowSizes.capacity() <= 0) 
00173          UTIL_THROW("rowSizes.capacity() must be positive");
00174 
00175       capacity = 0; 
00176       for (i = 0; i < rowSizes.capacity(); ++i) {
00177          if (rowSizes[i] < 0) 
00178             UTIL_THROW("rowSizes must all be nonnegative");
00179          capacity += rowSizes[i];
00180       }
00181 
00182       if (capacity == 0) 
00183          UTIL_THROW("Sum of row sizes must be positive");
00184 
00185       // Allocate all memory
00186       capacity1_  = rowSizes.capacity();
00187       capacity2_  = new int[capacity1_];
00188       rows_       = new Data*[capacity1_];
00189       data_       = new Data[capacity];
00190 
00191       // Set row sizes and pointers to rows
00192       Data* ptr = data_;
00193       for (i = 0; i < capacity1_; ++i) {
00194          capacity2_[i] = rowSizes[i];
00195          rows_[i] = ptr;
00196          ptr += rowSizes[i];
00197       }
00198       
00199    }
00200 
00202    template <class Data>
00203    inline bool DRaggedMatrix<Data>::isAllocated() const 
00204    {  return !(data_ == 0); }
00205
